intro: Aconogonon weyrichii subsp. savatieri, commonly known as the Weyrich's aconogonon, is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces striking, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Due to its ornamental value and unique floral display, it is appreciated by gardeners interested in exotic plants.
